constraints.description: Additional meta variables pattern to filter matching

files.description: Glob patterns to specify that the rule only applies to matching files

fix.description: A pattern to auto fix the issue. It can reference metavariables appeared in rule.

ignores.description: Glob patterns that exclude rules from applying to files

language.description: Specify the language to parse and the file extension to include in matching.

message.description: Main message highlighting why this rule fired. It should be single line and concise, but specific enough to be understood without additional context.

note.description: Additional notes to elaborate the message and provide potential fix to the issue.

rule.description:
A rule object to find matching AST nodes. We have three categories of rules in ast-grep.

* Atomic: the most basic rule to match AST. We have two variants: Pattern and Kind.

* Relational: filter matched target according to their position relative to other nodes.

* Composite: use logic operation all/any/not to compose the above rules to larger rules.

Every rule has it's unique name so we can combine several rules in one object.

severity.description: One of: hint, info, warning, or error

transform.description: A dictionary for metavariable manipulation. Dict key is the new variable name. Dict value is a [transformation] that specifies how meta var is processed. Warning: this is experimental option. [`https://github.com/ast-grep/ast-grep/issues/436`]

utils.description: Utility rules that can be used in `matches`

Convert.description: Converts the source meta variable's text content to a specified case format.

separatedBy.description: optional separators to specify how to separate word

source.description: source meta variable to be transformed

toCase.description: the target case format to convert the text content to

PatternStyle.description: A String pattern will match one single AST node according to pattern syntax. Or an object with field `context` and `selector`.

context.description: The surrounding code that helps to resolve any ambiguity in the syntax.

selector.description: The sub-syntax node kind that is the actual matcher of the pattern.

all.description: A list of sub rules and matches a node if all of sub rules match. The meta variables of the matched node contain all variables from the sub-rules.

any.description: A list of sub rules and matches a node if any of sub rules match. The meta variables of the matched node only contain those of the matched sub-rule.

follows.description: `follows` accepts a relational rule object. the target node must appear after another node matching the `follows` sub-rule.

has.description: `has` accepts a relational rule object. the target node must has a descendant node matching the `has` sub-rule.

inside.description: `inside` accepts a relational rule object. the target node must appear inside of another node matching the `inside` sub-rule.

kind.description: The kind name of the node to match. You can look up code's kind names in playground.

matches.description: A utility rule id and matches a node if the utility rule matches.

not.description: A single sub-rule and matches a node if the sub rule does not match.

pattern.description: A pattern string or a pattern object.

precedes.description: `precedes` accepts a relational rule object. the target node must appear before another node matching the `precedes` sub-rule.

regex.description: A Rust regular expression to match the node's text. https://docs.rs/regex/latest/regex/#syntax

Replace.description: Replaces a substring in the meta variable's text content with another string.

replace.description: a regex to find substring to be replaced

source.description: source meta variable to be transformed

oneOf.description: A regex to filter metavar based on its textual content.
A pattern to filter matched metavar based on its AST tree shape.

oneOf.description: A kind reminder for code with potential improvement.
A suggestion that code can be improved or optimized.
A warning that code might produce bugs or does not follow best practice.
An error that code produces bugs or has logic errors.

Substring.description:
Extracts a substring from the meta variable's text content.

Both `start_char` and `end_char` support negative indexing, which counts character from the end of an array, moving backwards.

endChar.description: optional ending character index of the substring, defaults to the end of the string.

source.description: source meta variable to be transformed

startChar.description: optional starting character index of the substring, defaults to 0.

Transformation.description: Represents a transformation that can be applied to a matched AST node. Available transformations are `substring`, `replace` and `convert`.
